actions.committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: A bill to amend title 39, United States Code, to provide for the mailing of correspondence to Members of the Congress free of postage.

summary.text: Provides that any correspondence to any Member of Congress which is: (1) sent to any official business address of the Member; and (2) mailed by a resident of the State or congressional district which is represented by the Member; may be mailed free of postage. Directs the Postal Service to maintain a supply of mailing forms for use in correspondence to Members of Congress, to be available at a nominal cost. (Amends 39 U.S.C. 3220)

titles.title: A bill to amend title 39, United States Code, to provide for the mailing of correspondence to Members of the Congress free of postage.
